com/pg/

pg_ptfarscan.pro


Routines

top pg_ptfarscan

NV/PG

result = pg_ptfarscan(dd, name=name, model=model, edge=edge, ccmin=ccmin, gdmax=gdmax, smooth=smooth, wmod=wmod, wpsf=wpsf, sky=sky, nsig=nsig, median=median, mask=mask, extend=extend, nmax=nmax, chifit=chifit)

Attempts to find all occurrences of a model in an image.

Return value

An array of type POINT giving the detected position for each object. The correlation coeff value for each detection is saved in the data portion of POINT with tag 'scan_cc'. SEE ALSO: pg_ptscan STATUS: Complete.

Parameters

dd in

Data descriptor

Keywords

name
model in

Point spread model to be used in correlation. If not given a default gaussian is used.

edge in

Distance from edge from which to ignore points. If not given, an edge distance of 0 is used.

ccmin in

Minimum correlation to consider in search. Default is 0.8.

gdmax in

If given, points where the gradient of the correlation function is higher than this value are not considered in the search.

smooth in

If given, the input image is smoothed using this width before any further processing.

wmod in

x, ysize of default gaussian model.

wpsf in

Half width of default gaussian psf model.

sky in

If set, it is assumed that the image contains only point sources and sky. Any object more than nsig standard deviations above the image mean are selected as candidates.

nsig in

For use with the /sky option, standard deviation threshold for detecting point sources.

median in

If given, the input image is filtered using a median filter of this width before any further processing.

mask in

If set, an attempt is made to mask out extended objects before performing the scan

extend in

If nonzero, star masks are extended by this many pixels in all directions.

nmax in

Max. number of point sources to return. If more are found, nsig is raised until thiws is satisified.

chifit

Author information
